resources.string: Depending on your credit card agreement, your bank may charge a fee on all foreign exchange transactions. Here you can enter that fee. It will be added on top of the calculation, so you know how much you really pay.
Show the current conversion for each rate in the currency picker.
Use pure black in dark mode

Exchangerate.host sources the currency rates from various financial data providers and banks, including the European Central Bank. All exchange rate data are delivered in midpoint data. Midpoint rates are determined by calculating the average median rate of Bid and Ask.\nAbout 160 currencies are included.
Frankfurter.app tracks reference exchange (forex) rates published by the European Central Bank.\nAbout 30 currencies are included.
Fer.ee is a relatively new service, that (just like Frankfurter.app) does track reference exchange (forex) rates that are published by the European Central Bank.\nAbout 30 currencies are included.

InforEuro provides the European Commission’s official monthly accounting rate for the Euro and the conversion rates as established by the Accounting Officer of the European Commission in line with article 19 of the Financial Regulation.\nThese rates are used to calculate amounts for the reimbursement of expenses, travel or subsistence costs for external people participating in meetings, interviews etc. at the request of the European Commission.\nAbout 150 currencies are included.
Daily average exchange rates of the Bank of Canada.\nAbout 23 currencies are included.
Exchange rates, as provided by the Norwegian central bank Norges Bank.\nNorges Bank lists some 40 exchange rates.

Exchange rates, as provided by the Russian central bank Bank Rossii. With the current sanctions, this source gives probably the most reliable data of exchange rates to Russian Ruble.\nBank Rossii lists some 44 exchange rates.
Exchange rates are updated around midnight UTC every working day.
The data is getting updated around 16:00 CET every working day.
Rates are updated every working day.

The rates indicated are the market rates for the second to last day of the previous month as quoted by the European Central Bank or, depending on availability, provided by the delegations or other appropriate sources close to that date.
The rates are published once each business day by 16:30 ET
Publication time of daily exchange rates is approximately 16:00 CET.
Rates are updated on a daily basis, except on public holidays in Russia.

Although the app is very thoroughly written and tested, there is no guarantee that the data it shows is correct. The exchange rates are provided by a third party and this app can\'t make no promise whatsoever that the data is true and up-to-date.\nAdditionally, the rates provided – still if correct – may vary from the ones used by your bank.\nLastly: Mistakes happen. Never blindly trust anyone! That being said, rest assured I wouldn\'t have released this app if I\'ve had any doubt that it works as intended.
This app is open source. Go to the code repository to open issues, find out how to contribute or just have a look at the sources.
If you\'d like, you can help others to discover Currencies. Click here to rate the app on Google Play.
